medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The cough began 9 months prior to the current evaluation and was intermittently productive of yellow sputum. It waxed and waned in intensity, with worsening during a trip to the Middle East 10 days before the current visit, accompanied by chills and increased yellow-green sputum production. Antitussive medications did not relieve symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy diagnosed 5 years ago, previous episodes of upper respiratory infections and sinusitis 3 years ago, placement of an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator for ventricular tachycardia, allergic rhinitis, obstructive sleep apnea, gonococcal urethritis, dyslipidemia.
medical_history.family_history: Several first-degree relatives had hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; mother died from pulmonary tuberculosis 3 years ago.
medical_history.social_history: Born in South Asia and raised in the Middle East, currently an executive who travels frequently. Divorced with one child. Smoked cigars occasionally and drank 1 to 2 glasses of wine nightly, but did not use illicit substances.
